title: The 5 Best Foods To Boost Immunity
description: Are you looking to strengthen your immunity?
cleaned_text: Foods That Boost Your Immunity - Category: [Health & Wellness](/news-updates/?CategoryID=188059), [Blog](/news-updates/?CategoryID=188087) - Posted On: - Written By: RRH Using Nutrient-Rich Foods to Your Advantage Are you looking to strengthen your immunity? Eating a well-balanced diet can help you [stay healthy](/news-updates/) and ward off illnesses. Here are some of the best dietary options that can boost your immune system: 1. Fruits and Vegetables There is no doubt that fruits and vegetables are packed with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. Citrus fruits like oranges and lemons contain [vitamin C](https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements-vitamin-c/art-20363932#:~:text=Vitamin%20C%20is%20an%20antioxidant,disease%2C%20cancer%20and%20other%20diseases.), which helps fight infection. Leafy green veggies such as spinach, kale, broccoli, and cabbage are full of folate that helps create [new cells in the body](https://ods.od.nih.gov/factsheets/Folate-Consumer/). 2. Nuts & Seeds Nuts such as almonds and walnuts contain essential fatty acids that can provide anti-inflammatory benefits for your body's cells. Also, chia, sunflower, and flax seeds are rich in [omega-3 fatty acids](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/articles/17290-omega-3-fatty-acids) that aid in the creation of immunity cells. 3. Whole Grains Eating whole grains such as quinoa, oats, and brown rice will give your body a good source of complex carbohydrates which help to sustain energy throughout the day. They also contain [vitamins B6](https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/vitamin-b6/), folate, and selenium, which help create new red blood cells and keep your body running at its peak performance level. 4. Herbs & Spices Incorporating herbs and spices like turmeric, ginger, garlic, oregano, and cayenne pepper into your diet can help [reduce inflammation](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3665023/#:~:text=The%20health%2Dpromoting%20perspectives%20of,pain%20after%20intense%20physical%20activity.) within the body. You can also use these natural remedies to fight off colds and other illnesses. 5. Lean Meats & Fish Lean meats, such as chicken and turkey, are a good source of zinc which helps your immune system fight infection. Adding fatty fish like salmon, tuna, and mackerel to your diet can provide omega-3 fatty acids that help reduce inflammation.
